Description: Body sherd of Chian of Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with trace of added red centre above two white bands; below, band of pendant pomegrenates; exterior: slip partly worn; painted decoration consisting of lion (part of open mouth remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941.
Inked 'n p 72' on underside, demonstrating provenance of Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0586) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 72 (Other Accession Number)
